text: I am making something super fun today
guys you're going to love it it's cream
puffs with a raspberry filling and
chocolate sauce start off with making
cream puffs though you have to make Pat
a choux which is a classic pastry that's
used for eclairs and cream puffs all
kinds of fantastic desserts to make it
you start off on the stove actually with
a cup of water and the stick of butter
you need to melt those together with a
teaspoon of sugar and if you're me
little pinch of salt
let your butter melt in your water mmm
when the butter is completely melted
just briefly remove it from heat I just
turn off the heat and add a cup of
all-purpose flour you stir it in till
it's fully combined and then return it
to the heat or turn the heat back on to
a medium and what you look for here is
you're trying to cook off as much of the
moisture as you can because you're going
to add some eggs later and you want to
replace the moisture that you cooked off
with the eggs moisture so you cook
stirring on top of the stove until it
gets nice and dry remove it from the
heat completely and let it cool for
about 2 minutes when the dough is cooled
just a bit you can transfer it to a
mixer can use a hand mixer for this but
I think that the standing mixer works
really well if you have one it's a great
use for this I just like to be just a
little bit to release a little bit more
of that steam because what you're going
to do is add eggs and you don't want the
eggs to start cooking so what you do is
you add four eggs one at a time and you
just beat till it combines and it gets
really nice and elastic all right add
the other egg and then another one if
you drive your dough out properly you
should easily get poor eggs added in and
sometimes you might even need to add
just a little bit more you can whisk
together a fifth egg and add a tiny bit
at a time if necessary
I think this is looking pretty good nice
and stretchy put it into a pastry bag I
like to put my pastry bags in two quart
containers just so it stands upright and
I have I don't have to try to hold on to
the pastry bag while I'm filling it you
also fold the top of the pastry bag down
and then that part stays nice and clean
oh so many tips and tricks I'm sharing
with you have your oven preheating to
425 degrees and then line two baking
sheets with parchment paper I'm just
going to go ahead and pipe one inch
rounds leaving about an inch between
each one to anchor your charts on paper
so that it doesn't slide around while
you're piping you can pipe a tiny bit of
the paddle shoe into the corners and
that will hold the paper down nifty
little trick huh I like to pipe straight
down and then like a little flick of the
wrist to pull it off if you were making
profiteroles you would do the exact same
thing that I'm doing here and then you
would fill them with ice cream make them
a little bit bigger maybe you might want
to wet your finger just a little bit too
there's sometimes a little peak on the
top and just Pat that down with a damp
finger get them into a 425 degree oven
and bake for ten minutes then reduce the
temperature to 350 and bake until
they're puffed golden and cook through
about 30 minutes more to finish your
cream puffs off you want to make a
chocolate glaze and then a raspberry
filling with whipped cream so bring a
half a cup of heavy cream to a boil with
a tablespoon of corn syrup when your
cream comes to a boil pour it
immediately over four ounces of chopped
semi-sweet chocolate don't start it yet
because you want to give the heavy cream
time to warm up the chocolate a little
bit so you can get your whipped cream
mixture ready while you're waiting here
are my cooled cream puffs you want to
make a small hole in the bottom of each
puff to pipe the filling in you can use
a skewer as small as you think that you
can to actually also then get the
filling in so a quarter of an inch might
work might need to be slightly bigger
this part of the cream puffs can be made
ahead baked and frozen and then
defrosted excellently for the filling
one cup of cream that I've whipped going
to give it one more whisk just to make
sure it stiff enough because you want it
to hold up it's too soft it'll just ooze
out and to that add a quarter cup of
raspberry jam you can use any flavor you
want you want these to be strawberry go
ahead and use strawberry you want to
whisk this in till everything is fully
combined I'm going to set this aside for
just a sec while I stir my glaze
together once the chocolate has had the
hot cream on it for a couple of minutes
about five minutes it should smooth out
really really easily
there we go that's our glaze now you can
transfer your fillings to a pastry bag
you can still use a resealable bag with

kind of cool
and they bake up they puff up and they
create a hollow inside and that's what

the top of each of your cream puffs in
the chocolate glaze aren't those pretty
yes they are these are so elegant and
